security_audit.summary: This skill is purely documentation containing instructions and reference guides for creating Agent Skills. No executable code, no network access, no file system access, no environment variable access, and no command execution capabilities. The skill does exactly what it claims to do with no hidden or excessive capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating Agent Skills requires understanding a specific file format and directory structure. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building skills that work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.
actual_capabilities: Create SKILL.md files with proper YAML frontmatter and Markdown instructions
Structure skill directories with optional scripts, references, and assets folders
Follow naming conventions for skill names and descriptions
Implement progressive disclosure to manage context efficiently
Reference additional documentation from within skills
Validate skill structure against the official specification
limitations: Does not execute code or create actual files on disk
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not provide pre-built skill templates
Does not validate or test created skills

use_cases.title: Build New Skills
use_cases.description: Create well-structured Agent Skills following the official specification format and best practices.

use_cases.title: Write Reference Docs
use_cases.description: Structure reference materials in separate files for efficient context management in skills.

use_cases.title: Extend AI Capabilities
use_cases.description: Create custom skills that add specialized knowledge and workflows to AI agents.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Skill Creation
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new skill from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] in the [directory] folder. The skill should [description of what it does]. Follow the Agent Skills format specification.

prompt_templates.title: Add Reference Files
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a reference document to the [skill-name] skill that covers [topic]. The reference should explain [key concepts] with examples.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that the [skill-name] skill follows the correct format. Check the frontmatter, directory structure, and instruction quality.

prompt_templates.title: Progressive Disclosure
prompt_templates.prompt: Restructure [skill-name] to use progressive disclosure. Move detailed reference material to separate files and keep main instructions concise.

output_examples.input: Create a skill called 'pdf-helper' that extracts text from PDF files.
output: Added frontmatter with name and description
Included optional references/ folder for detailed documentation
Skill ready for activation when user needs PDF help

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for efficient context loading
Include specific keywords in descriptions to help agents identify relevant tasks
Use relative paths for file references and keep them one level deep
Match the skill directory name exactly to the frontmatter name field
anti_patterns: Using uppercase letters or consecutive hyphens in skill names
Putting all documentation in SKILL.md without using references/ folder
Writing vague descriptions that do not explain when to use the skill
Leaving optional directories (scripts/, references/, assets/) empty

faq.question: What is the minimum required file for a skill?
faq.answer: Every skill needs at minimum a SKILL.md file with YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields.

faq.question: What characters are allowed in skill names?
faq.answer: Skill names must use only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. They cannot start or end with a hyphen or contain consecutive hyphens.

faq.question: How do I reference external files in my skill?
faq.answer: Use relative paths from the skill root. Place referenced files in scripts/, references/, or assets/ folders and reference them with paths like references/FILE.md.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides documentation guidance. It does not read, write, or transmit any files or data.

faq.question: Why is my skill not appearing in the skill list?
faq.answer: Verify that the skill directory name matches the name field in SKILL.md frontmatter exactly. Check that frontmatter uses valid YAML format.

faq.question: How is this skill different from other skills?
faq.answer: This is a meta-skill that teaches how to create skills. Other skills perform specific tasks. This skill provides instructions rather than executing actions.
